arts.ttl: Tony Docherty brands Celtic penalty 'soft' as Dundee boss admits 'decisions went against us'
arts.sum: The Dundee boss reckons the big decisions went against his side as they were hit for six for the second game in a row

arts.ttl: Reaction as 'devastating' Celtic turn on style
arts.sum: Post-match analysis as Celtic demolish Dundee 6-0.

arts.ttl: Arne Engels and Daizen Maeda doubles lead Celtic’s 6-0 demolition of Dundee
arts.sum: Celtic have extended their lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership to 13 points with a 6-0 demolition of Dundee at Celtic Park. Arne Engels scored with a penalty in the 18th minute following the intervention of VAR before Adam Idah struck in first-half added time for his fourth goal in three games. The Japan winger Daizen Maeda helped himself to two goals in four second-half minutes just before the hour mark and Engels produced a glorious fifth in the 71st minute before the substitute Nicolas Kühn curled in No 6 to complete the rout for Brendan Rodgers’s side. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Brendan Rodgers drops Celtic truth bomb that proves there are no 'side effects' from failed striker search
arts.sum: The Hoops cruised to an 6-0 win with a stunning display under the lights at Parkhead

arts.ttl: 'One of the best': Rodgers delighted after six-goal Celtic triumph
arts.sum: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers was delighted with his team's 6-0 win over Dundee.

arts.ttl: Man City draw Real & Celtic face Bayern in Champions League play-offs
arts.sum: Manchester City will play Real Madrid while Celtic will face Bayern Munich in the Champions League play-off round.

arts.ttl: Daizen Maeda has Jota in stitches as bursting Celtic TV interviewer sees return hype derailed by three-word answer
arts.sum: The Portuguese winger couldn't help but laugh with his pal after seeing off Dundee

arts.ttl: Celtic fans are all saying the same thing after watching Jota's performance against Dundee
arts.sum: After Jota’s comeback goal against Motherwell over the weekend, he was thrown straight into the starting XI for the rearranged Premiership fixture against Dundee. Brendan Rodgers’ side didn’t even need to put their foot on the accelerator, yet Celtic managed to put six goals past Dundee and Jota was doing what he does best.

arts.ttl: Celtic skip closer to Premiership title after dismantling Dundee
arts.sum: It was a desperate night for Tony Docherty’s Dundee, who lost 6-0 at home to Hearts at the weekend.

arts.ttl: Celtic put six past Dundee to restore 13-point lead at top
arts.sum: Celtic cruised to a 6-0 victory at home against Dundee to restore their 13-point lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership table.
